name: test with a bunch of other stuff
primaryNotes: ["test note","test"]
secondaryNotes: ["test sec note","tst"]

name: Dark Sweet Cherry
primaryNotes: ["1/4tsp PE on frozen sweet dark cherries 24hrs prior","remove at 10-14 days. ferment another 2 weeks. "]
secondaryNotes: ["1/4 PE on frozen dark sweet cherries","add after fermentation has gone dry, remove in 10-14 days, taste & backsweeten"]

name: Green Tea session mead
primaryNotes: ["\"Water\"","Water is tea brewed with 20g of looseleaf sencha and 10g looseleaf tencha - 1.7L per steep, with two bags of gyokuro added in the second steep."]
secondaryNotes: ["Second tea addition","Rack mead onto 1 cup of strong brewed Dragon Pearl jasmine green tea. Use a milk frother to stir in the second charge of FT Blanc Soft and 1tsp matcha powder."]

name: KIVEK 1
primaryNotes:
["56lbs total (w/o lid)
Jug TW 13.8lbs
~7.5lbs Clover Honey
~3.4lbs Tulip Poplar Honey
Frontload 40.5g Fermaid K

Pitched 12/23/25 @ 1612hrs","Add Remaining Fermaid K:
Date & Time ____________
Amount _____________"]

name: Dark Sweet Cherry
primaryNotes: ["Add pectin enzyme 24hrs prior to starting fermentation. Remove fruit as fermentation slows",""]
secondaryNotes: ["Add cherries for conditioning/secondary. Remove when fruit looses color. No more than 2 weeks",""]

name: RAPT Pill 1.120 Calibration Solution
primaryNotes:
["This is just a water and sugar solution to do an max range advanced calibration on a Rapt Pill.
10 cups of Water
1Kg of Table Sugar

Put 10 cups of water first and do point 1 for the calibration.

Add the 1kg of Sugar and mix until dissolved.

Continue with point 2 for calibration.

",""]
secondaryNotes: ["Make some lemonade or tea when you are done with calibration.",""]

name: Strawberry Kiwi Mead
primaryNotes:
["Pectic Enzyme","- Standard rate: ~ teaspoon per gallon of must.
- For this 2-gallon batch: ~1 teaspoon total.

","Nutrient Additions","Add in staggered nutrient additions (SNA)split doses on Day 0, Day 2, Day 4, Day 6.


"]

name: Black Locust Trad
secondaryNotes: ["Backsweeten to taste, but range of 1.010 to 1.020.",""]

name: The Perfect Remedy
primaryNotes: ["Make tea","Brew green tea (approximately 26 tablespoons) in 3-4 gallons of brewing water at 170F for 2 minutes","Add water","Add remainder of water to kettle to reduce temperature.","Add honey","Dissolve honey into warm water.","Transfer","Transfer must to fermenting vessel.","Ginger","Slice ginger thin, sanitize, and add all to primary.","Yeast starter","Stir in Goferm to prescribed amount of must. Add yeast to mix.","Pitch yeast","Add yeast to must when at approximately 100F. Add all fermaid O.","Add bentonite","","Temperature control","Add heater and temp controller and keep at approximately 95F."]
secondaryNotes: ["Stabilize.","Double stabilizer and add to primary.","Lemon flavor","Add lemon flavoring. Bench trial first time.","Clarify","Stir in sparkolloid and allow to clear.","Can",""]

name: Peach Mead - 10.07 ABV
primaryNotes:
["1lb Peaches

Backsweeten with .5 lb Wildflower Honey","1.060
Red Star Cuvee
Fermaid O at 0, 2 and 4 days
Stabilized with Potassium Sorbate and Camden Tabs "]

name: blueberry
secondaryNotes: ["Mint","Mint to be added for a 1 week. "]

name: Thai Tea (Method 2)
primaryNotes: ["Brew a half gallon of tea with a gallons worth of Thai tea for a double concentrate. Then strain, add honey and top off the gallon to assist with cooling. Pitch when under 80F.",""]
secondaryNotes: ["Add a concentrated Thai tea base if flavor isn't strong enough","","Don't use the lactic acid if the brew is already too acidic. If it's still too sharp, use a bit of oak cubes for a while or backsweeten more.",""]

name: Chocolate Mint
primaryNotes: ["Ferment a traditional and rack into 1.5 gallon fermenter.",""]
secondaryNotes: ["Add Cacao Nibs and vanilla beans into brew bag and sink for 2 weeks. Taste regularly to see if chocolate flavor was imparted. Backsweeten here.","","Rack into 1 gallon carboy for clearing. After clearing, drop mint leaves in disposable tea bag for 2-3 days until desired mint level is reached.",""]

name: Coffee Mead
primaryNotes: ["Nutrients day 1, 2 and 5",""]
secondaryNotes: ["Custom Ingredient = Caramel Syrup",""]

name: Strawberry Mead
primaryNotes: ["Nutrients Day 1, 2 and 5",""]

name: Banana Wine
primaryNotes: ["Puree bananas","Use over ripe bananas. Weigh out 1/2 bananas w/o peel and other half with until correct weight.\nPuree bananas and cut peels. Mix with pectic.","Mix must","Reserve water needed for Go-Ferm. Mix water and sugar until dissolved, then add banana mix. Drill attachement.","Add additives","Add tannin and amylase and mix","Pitch Yeast","Mix Go-Ferm in 110 F water and stand until ~100 F. Gently stir in yeast, let stand for ~20mins. Add must until temp lowers by 18 F, let stand for ~15-20mins. repeat until within 18 F of must and pitch.","Add nutrients and degas","After lag phase, 48 hrs, and 1/3 sugar break.\nDegas every day, sometimes 2x a day at the beginning.","Rack and stabilize","Mesh strainer to rack. Stabilize and wait 48hrs."]
secondaryNotes: ["Balance","back sweeten with simple syrup. MAYBE add acids through bench trial. Probably no acid for authentic banana flavour.","Clear and rack","Sparkolloid and wait for ~1 weeks then age for ~6-8 months. Bottle a few to taste after a few months to see if you can drink earlier."]

name: Winter 2025 mixed berry BFM lite
primaryNotes:
["Fruit ","A mix of frozen blueberry (9 lbs) and blueberry, raspberry, blackberry mix (9 lbs). Will be split into two 2 week additions in primary for volume reasons. ","Additives","-EX-V goes in with the fruit at pitch
-Tannins go in at 1/3rd sugar break
-Bentonite on day 3 ","Honey ","ATS mango 12 lbs
wildflower 2 lbs"]

name: 1st Traditional
primaryNotes:
["11 Dec 2025
- Rehydrate yeast in 3.3g Go-Ferm
- Add honey and water to 10L pail and mix with electric whisk
- Pitch yeast","Bloodwood Honey from Scoop
Original Gravity: 1.094","12 Dec 2025
- At 24hr mark, add 1.4g Fermaid O","Gravity: 1.092","13 Dec 2025
- At 48hr mark, add 1.4g Fermaid O","","14 Dec 2025
- At 72hr mark, add 1.4g Fermaid O
- 1/3 sugar break hit, add another 1.4g Fermaid O","Gravity: 1.060","21 Dec 2025
- Stirred slowly to degass ","Gravity: 1.000

Realized stirring is not necessary as it stirs up the lees and will take time for it to drop to the bottom again."]
secondaryNotes:
["28 Dec 2025
- Rack to 5L carboy
- Stabilize with 0.439g k-meta and 0.757g k-sorb","GRAVITY?","DATE
- After 24hrs, back-sweetened with ?kg honey","GRAVITY?"]

primaryNotes: ["Puree primary blueberries","Puree and mix in pectic enzyme","Mix must. Reserve 300 mL water or must","Add honey, water and puree to bucket. Mix with drill attachment","Pitch yeast","100 F water & mix go-ferm. Cool to 104 F and rehydrate yeast, stand for 20mins then stir again. Acclimate by 18 F stand for 15-20mins. Repeat then pitch when within 18F of must and mix in.","Add additives","Mix tannin, FT Blanc, Opti Red in with reserved must/water and pour in must","Rack and stabilize","Rack into bucket for secondary"]
secondaryNotes: ["Add 8 lbs of puree blueberries","Gently stir in and let sit for ~2 weeks, tasting regularly for desired flavour / strength","Rack into carboy and balance","Back sweeten with 100mL honey and taste. Add more if needed. Add acid blend 1/8 tsp at a time and taste. Consider bench trial to get it right.","Clarify and keg","Sparkolloid and let sit until clear. Rack directly into keg at 32 PSI for week+."]

primaryNotes: ["Go-Ferm amount","Note that Go-Ferm requirement is a ~1-1 ratio to yeast by volume or approximately half a tablespoon in this case. ","Fermaid-K additions","Since DAP crystals clearly separate out in my nutrients I add more DAP initially and more organics (essentially ferm-O) during the 3rd/4th additions. ","Apple Juice Origin","A WF spiced \"cider\". Seems to be slightly sweeter than typical apple juice so the Brix in this recipe has been adjusted accordingly. Has added spices as well as lemon juice. "]
